name: Honey Japanese Curry
author: Adrien
description: Spicy, sweet, floral, vegiterian, onion-y goodness, definitely not from Vermont.

actions.step: Add the onions and the chili peppers along with another splash of oil and salt.
Sautee the onions until brown, adding vegetable stock or water if the contents of the pot are too dry.
Sautee briefly, then cover with water, measuring how much is added.
Bring water to a boil, skimming off any foam that rises to the top.
When the carrots are soft, add curry blocks according to the measured amount of water.
Add honey and simmer until the sauce reaches the desired consistency.
Serve over hot rice. Garnish with apple slices.
